body.p:
your highly esteemed favour of the
inst came to hand, and its contents noted, I do
not know what could have been more acceptable
to me than a few lines from a friend, I say a friend!
from the fact, that the tenor of the epistle evinced
the very strongest marks of true friendship, the lieniency?
that you have professed on your part shall not be abused
by me, although at this time I am compelled to take advan
tage of it, my situation has been such for the last few
years past and up to the present time, that my income
has been barely sufficient for to maintain my large
family, But thank God I think that my prospects
are brightening. I regret exceedingly that circum-
stance has placed me unable to meet the first note
that is part due, but hope to be able soon to do
something for you. I hope your health is improving
we all should like to see you here, concerning
the “Occident” I shall try my best to disseminate
it you may depend upon, the folks here lack that
that energy for reading

We are all sadly disapointed with our imported
Hazan, he is not the man that we expected to get, as
to his qualifications for a teacher he cannot be excelled
but he is no Hazan, nor will he ever make one

he is by no means the man that I expected, after
bargaining with him for $500 the first year as Hazan &
teacher whilst he was in Europe, and he agreeing to
come on and perform the functions for that term, it
turns out that he never has been accustomed to read
in our Minhag and can't read, not having the tunes
but wants to demand a salary of $500 for each
office saying that was the way he understood it,
the letters I wrote to him were the most explicit
and his answer goes to show that he understood
them precisely the way I intended, and not alone
that I sent the Printed advertisement from
the Occident to him so that there would be
no misunderstanding about the matter, but of
no avail, he is one of those noble Polanders
and wants to continue my communications to suit
his purposes, One thing I may say safely that
there is the greatest unanimity about the
matter we all think alike, and I as secretary
sustained as to the correctness of my correspondence
with him whilst in Europe, I regret that after
all our trouble that our efforts will prove abor-
tive, but it can't be helped, I was in hopes
that all would go on smoothly. He delivered
several prayers in the House of Delegates, which was
listened to with much attention, I expect that the
event of an Israelite opening a legislature with
prayer, stands unparralled in the world, and
I am proud that old Virginia has let this noble

example, there was a resolution offerred at
the last session authorizing the speaker to request
the ministers of the different Christian denomina
tions to open the house with prayer, it was amen
ded by striking out the word Christian, and carried
by a large majority, Mr Michelbacker was at
that time called upon to officiate in his term
but did not respond to the call, and I felt proud
to think that our congregation would be able
send a minister, one of his short prayers was
by request of one of the members published I
believe you have the paper with it in, as it
was sent to you

Give my love to all, I will send
you a description of the “fall” for the ?
No of Occident

Accept for yourself assurances of
high regard and believe me to remain as
